level.heading: DUTIES OF COLLABORATING PHYSICIAN TO PATIENT (ยง 17-4713)

level.text: A collaborating physician shall take a patient’s medical history and perform a physical examination, and shall advise a patient of the findings of the examination.
A collaborating physician shall advise the patient of treatment alternatives for the patient’s condition.
A collaborating physician shall place conditions or restrictions on the course of treatment in acupuncture if the patient’s condition requires them as a matter of sound medical practice.
A collaborating physician shall advise a patient to return to the collaborating physician for consultation if one of the following conditions occurs:
The patient develops new symptoms; or
The patient’s condition does not improve after a prescribed course of treatment by the acupuncturist.

A collaborating physician shall be available to a patient at reasonable times for consultation by appointment or telephone and shall give the patient written notice of the physician’s telephone number and office address.
If a collaboration is terminated by the collaborating physician, the physician shall assist the patient whose acupuncture treatment is disrupted to find appropriate substitute care.
